website_summaries.verdict: A great value for a hard drive with lots of space and smooth performance.
pros: Operates quietly when transferring data and doesn’t get hot during long sessions
cons: Proprietary cable means you can’t use jut any micro-USB cable with it

website_summaries.verdict: Western Digital's modern travel external hard drive with a good amount of storage.
pros: Comes with up to 4 terabytes of storage contained within a durable shell
Plug-and-play capabilities allow the computer to detect the hard drive without any drivers
cons: The computer/hard drive connection can drop at times during file transfers

customer_reviews.title: PS4 Memory
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my boyfriend. The 4TB external worked great for his PS4. He said some of the memory was used for converting but he has 7x the amount of space he started with. He is very happy with this item and I will update my review if he comes across any problems. Update 2 1/2 years layer. Still running well!
customer_reviews.author: Des

customer_reviews.title: **MAC USERS- TAKE NOTE!
customer_reviews.text: **FOR MAC USERS!! After 2 "failed" drives were sent back, I called customer support to find out why I wasn't able to troubleshoot via any online methods, and get this to work for my mac! Apparently the solution was insanely easy, but I never saw this eeeasy solution online in any of the forums I found. The issue with erasing/formatting for a mac just has to do with the view you have open in Disk Utility. Make sure you go to View > Show All Devices, and then "erase" the top tier drive. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Click of Death
customer_reviews.text: First drive was dead on arrival with the click of death. I figured I'd give them another shot, since failures happen. Sent it back to Amazon, got a replacement. Second drive lasted less than a week before *click* *click* *click*, it too was dead. Sent it back for a refund. Two failures out of two drives is too high for a third chance.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M McCarroll

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Xbox One compliment
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup with Xbox One X. Got the 4TB version... I figure I can hold 35+ 4K HDR games between the external drive and the 1TB on the machine, which will give me a number of years of game acquisition capability, and have another USB port if I need additional expansion years down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Tseg

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable and with excellent size external USB Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I am using this USB external hard driver as an extended storage device for the Sony's PS4-Pro. The process to install it is very simple, the storage is very reliable, and the data transference seems very stable.
customer_reviews.author: HMS

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: The 1 star reviews here are correct that the device will potentially fail. The drive started making a clicking sound and isn't recognized by my computer, which is what other people are saying as well. I only had it for 1 week. Now I will have to re-install a data library on a different drive which will take many hours.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cochrane

customer_reviews.title: Love it, small & speedy
customer_reviews.text: I love this hard drive. It works great for all my docs that were cramming up my computer. I have uploaded a pic for you Mac users to see how to reformat the hard drive to be able to use it. It takes only like 4 clicks. 😁 Type in your Mac search bar for “disk utility” app, select the new hard drive, and then in the popup box where you see “Format”, in that drop down menu select “Mac OS Extended” then click “Erase”. That’s it, you can start dragging docs to the drive. Super easy. :) I’m glad I bought it cuz its affordable & has a lot of storage! 😁
customer_reviews.author: OC88

customer_reviews.title: Died in one month!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this drive on February 1, 2018 and it failed on March 1, 2018 with very little use. I should have listened to the negative reviews about this drive. Now all my data on this drive is gone due to a "Device I/O error."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more Western Digital
customer_reviews.text: This crashed (I mean, literally, without warning) within 2 months. I started receiving "SMART Utility" warnings about bad segments, I/O errors, etc., and before I could make a backup copy of this drive, it just stopped working. It refused to mount on any of my computers. Just Dead. And rather deal with the warranty (would YOU want a strange company to have eventual access to what's on your computer drives?), I destroyed it, and ordered a similar product from Toshiba, a much more reliable disk manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan P. Saltzman

customer_reviews.title: 2 TB drive in a 4 TB box
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 4 terabyte portable elements drive directly from Amazon but despite what the box said, or the serial number on the back of the drive enclosure, it actually had a 2 terabyte hard drive inside. It registers as having only 1.63 TB capacity when plugged into my pc. Unfortunately, I didn't realize this in time to return it. Make sure you check it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Nice price for the amount of space but very fragile
customer_reviews.text: My first order worked fine no problem, I had backed up a bunch data that was on CD's I had purchased and then this baby accidentally fell off the table 1 time and never worked again. Which sucked because I had just finished getting rid of CD's that I was backing up. I had to order a second drive. This Video is what happened to the original drive. It sounds like it stops spinning and It doesn't show up on computer.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: not reliable
customer_reviews.text: After loading 1tb of programs 5 days later died.I have never had a hard drive have a hard failure ever.And I probably have over 50 hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Anderson

customer_reviews.title: SUpersimple and compatible with Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: Got this to hook up to my Xbox One so I could store more games. Hookup was extremely simple and straightforward. Took less than ten minutes for the whole process of hooking it up and configuring it. Now I have tons of space for my games.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie Lynn

customer_reviews.title: I would strongly recommend not purchasing this product
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked for about a month and a half and then stopped for no reason and lost every file I have. I can no longer get my Mac to recognize this drive or access anything that is on it. Yes the drive was formatted correctly Western Digital Tech Support. I would strongly recommend not purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Casy Aldana

customer_reviews.title: BIG drive in a LITTLE space!
customer_reviews.text: This drive is much more than I thought it would be. Plug in ready and much smaller (physically) than I thought it would be. I thought 2TB would be a wee bit smaller than I needed but it wasn't until I did the actual math that I realized I'll be using this for years to come. I loaded some 500 pictures onto the drive and they took up a very tiny slice of the whole drive. Pleasantly surprised to say the least. Glad I bought it and would recommend it to anyone that wants one.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE TO USE WITH MACINTOSH TIMEMACHINE
customer_reviews.text: Macintosh TimeMachine failed to erase the contents of this drive when it prepped the drive to hold a Macintosh system backup. TimeMachine left the drive in an unusable state -- my Mac, my two Win10 boxes, and my Linux box cannot recognize the drive when I connect it now. Oh -- and the WD Elements drive utility cannot see the drive either. For all practical purposes, I have a $57 paperweight that blinks occasionally when I connect it to a computer. I am sure that this is a fine drive for most applications, but seems vulnerable to some fatal interaction with Mac TimeMachine. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen and Stan Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent exteral HD
customer_reviews.text: As always, I purchase WD external HDD, better product and better warranties. As a software developer, I constantly backup code, I usually wait for a good price on a 4TB and purchase a few. Seagate (in the 80's) did have a better product, but WD has definitely taken over this market.
customer_reviews.author: Spyke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I'm using for my ps4 to backup games and also to stored my movies. I formatted with my laptop too exfat32. Works perfect
customer_reviews.author: Luis Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: Drive capacity is great, however the drive is not very fast and ...
customer_reviews.text: Build quality seems OK. Drive capacity is great, however the drive is not very fast and not a good working drive for my photo archive I'd like to return the drive but unfortunately it's past 30 days since I received it. I'm getting around 60 MB/s write speed and 65 MB/s read speed
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: It is smaller than expected which makes it extremely comfortable to carry around! I am very pleased, it is extremely fast (I have to still fill it with crap (: ). It arrived extremely fast.
customer_reviews.author: Valeh Jiménez Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Works great as described.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Sony PlayStation 4 and it works like a charm. The PlayStation was able to format it and utilize it easily. Easy set up and use. Warning though don't unplug it while the PlayStation is turned on or in sleep mode.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Seems decent. For only a month.
customer_reviews.text: Started off great. Even loved the black on black. But didn't feel as hefty as my other 1TB units. But for the price point, I thought I had it set. Barely a month later. For maybe twice weekly usage, it has already failed. Not a cord problem or computer problem. Need to look to find a new and more reliable unit. It will fail, just depends how soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan N.

customer_reviews.title: Great value - formats easily for Mac.
customer_reviews.text: This worked out great for my iMac. Great price value. Only a small delay in getting it formatted for the Mac. There's an insert in the package that gives a link to the WD site showing you how to do it. Once you go to their site, the instructions are very simple and the drive works great. I have 8 WD Passport drives I've been using for 6 years and they have served me well.
customer_reviews.author: MarksALot

customer_reviews.title: Great for Xbox One.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Xbox One X. Those 4K updates sure take a huge chunk of space. Easy setup, and fast transfer speeds. Moved all my games from the 1TB external HDD I was using and it was quick. This thing is small too! Only negative thing I can say is that the proprietary USB cable that this comes with is quite short (1ft or so). Not a problem for me since this just sits next to the Xbox, but for other uses might be an issue. UPDATE 12/12/2018 Hard drive still going strong. No issues whatsoever. Running out of space though! :D
customer_reviews.author: V. Cortes

customer_reviews.title: If you are constantly reading and writing things on the  drive, look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: The thing that I disliked about the drive is that it failed after 7 months. I used the product to store shows for when I'm on the road.
customer_reviews.author: carlos garcia

customer_reviews.title: Feels very solid, doesn't attract fingerprints. It's not ...
customer_reviews.text: Feels very solid, doesn't attract fingerprints. It's not as bulky as I feared. Sequential write speeds average about 115MB/s. It does have a more noticeable vibration than my old 1TB and 2TB drives, but that may be expected as I assume the internal drive has more platters. Small rubber feet absorb the vibration, and the drive is still whisper quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Esparza

customer_reviews.title: it is nice I plugged it into the back of the xbox ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kids xbox, it is nice I plugged it into the back of the xbox and it asked me how I wanted to format it. Then I was able to move the games easily on the screen from the internal hard drive of the xbox to this external drive. It is nice now they have all of the games in one spot and when they go to their dad's house they can pick up where they left off instead of having multiple saves at each location. I told my kids if they fill this up, that means they have way too many games. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Julia Ousley

customer_reviews.title: Very, very slow.
customer_reviews.text: The USB-3 speed is definitely wasted on this disk, which runs at 1990s speeds, barely gives 6MB/sec when writing.
customer_reviews.author: asciilifeform

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It failed right after the return period ended. I lost a ton of backups between times I was able to upload to the cloud. The drive lights up showing it's getting power and is recognized by my Surface tablet but is not visible to windows explorer. Looked at numerous forums and sounds like it's a common occurrence where the drive just fails with no rhyme or reason. Tried several backup/restore software products to no avail. Better off to use free cloud storage from several sources such as Google or use this money to pay for extra storage on One Drive vs buying this product. What a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice, Gets Hot
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of this hard drive. As this is not a solid state hard drive it does not have stellar read and write speed, but it's good enough. 4TB gets really hot when writing files compared to the 2TB. Heat is worrying to the longevity of the device. I have owned a 2TB for about 4 years now and it is still going strong with no issues. I am hoping the 4TB will perform just as well. *Update: Have used 4TB drive for 1 year now. I report no issues other than it gets hot when copying large volumes.
customer_reviews.author: D.L. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Read the fine print
customer_reviews.text: I recently received this and began using it. It's a hard drive, it's not like I would need to read the tightly wadded piece of paper with it. When I finally did look at that tiny wad of paper, I found that there is a forced arbitration agreement bound with this hard drive. So if the hard drive should affect your computer negatively, you're into forced arbitration with a rich corporation that picks the arbitrator. Terrible, malignant policy. Not to mention that it isn't a 4TB drive; it's a 3.63TB drive. Very disappointed and won't buy another WD item again.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Using it for my Xbox One to store more games. Easy set up. Turn on Xbox. When Xbox boots up plug this in. Format for games or music. I chose games. Installs all games on it now. Simple. Once you set it up you do not need to unplug. Plugged in all the times works flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: Kristofer

customer_reviews.title: It Was Over Before It Started!
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews FIRST! I unboxed the hard drive and plugged it in. After 5 loud clicks, it died. I never even got to save any files to it! Clearly Amazon is knowingly sending faulty products and does not care. From now on I will read the 1-star reviews first!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Mom

customer_reviews.title: Another bites the dust
customer_reviews.text: I seriously don't know why I keep buying these in the hopes, I guess, that WD will improve on their reliability, but this has to be at least my second or third WD external hard drive that simply stopped working. Months and months of video editing and files gone. Thankfully I have a back up at home, but not of all the files. I don't think I could be convinced of buying another WD hard drive. Will you have better luck than me? Maybe, but I won't take my chances again.
customer_reviews.author: ChristianFromPeru

customer_reviews.title: Died after a month with my data
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hard drive, loaded my stuff onto it, and a month later, it is no longer accessible. I called customer service and they sent me a new cord in hopes that would resolve the issue, but it did not. Apparently they are happy to give a referral to a data recovery company, but they "aren't responsible" for the cost of that or the fact that their product is total garbage. Such a waste of time and money. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Recommended to me for my PS4
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine recommended it to me as extra storage for my PS4. Worked great for about 6 months, then today I turned my ps4 on and it wouldn’t read the storage. After failed attempts to get it working again and a few fix-it’s, I called it a wash. Also I’m not sure if it’s worth noting, but I think I’ll point it out anyway: I go through gaming phases and had barely played on my ps4 the last 6 months. The last couple of weeks are the most I’ve played since about Feb so I don’t know if it would’ve died on me sooner if I had been using it more extensively.
customer_reviews.author: Monica C

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 2.5 years
customer_reviews.text: Could have been five stars for convenience and looking after my backup data for two and a half years. But it suddenly, inexplicably, stopped working. Google for "WD Elements hard drive slow" or "WD Elements hard drive blinking light" and you'll see why I deducted two stars. Too many people complaining this just drops dead - I have to wonder about the QC under the sleek exterior. Luckily I have other copies of my data so I can shrug and throw this paperweight away.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: I was warned about these. Failed to operate as a back up in less than 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Started out easy enough as a main Mac back up drive then came the failure notification in less than 30 days. I see my data but can't add to it. Mac system tried to sort it out but no luck, waste of time and money from what I thought was a solid company. Worse, I can't send this back because it has my entire digital life stuck on it. I'll be reaching out for some kind of replacement option but it won't be the same.
customer_reviews.author: Charley Hogwood - Author of The Survival Group Handbook

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely great hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 6 of these over the past few years for various projects and clients, and I've never been disappointed. The 5TB size just came out in November 2019 and it just works. Silent, fast, conveniently portable, no extra power adapters. I recommend these over the larger drives that, despite having a higher capacity, run louder and hotter and probably won't last as long as these lil' guys. Hint. The price drops down to eighty nine dollhairs about once a month for a couple of days. Keep refreshing the page.
customer_reviews.author: a raccoon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Feel and A Little Loud
customer_reviews.text: The drive is nice enough, but it feels like the casing is very, very thin. This may be so it can release heat better and doesn't really impact the performance; just be sure you be careful with it. The cord is short and a little wobbly at the connector. It didn't have any big impact, but I ended up replacing it with a cheap cable I picked up from a dollar store because I needed a longer one. It's yet to see how durable the drive is, but anecdotally I've had very good luck with Western Digital and favor it when buying drives. I'm just not a fan of Seagate drives.
customer_reviews.author: Veil_Lord

customer_reviews.title: macOS Disk Utility Bricked the Drive Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: I attached this drive new out of the box to my MacBook running macOS Catalina (10.15.x). The drive is Windows-formatted out of the box; I ran Disk Utility to format the drive to APFS, and received a cryptic error message saying that the drive could not be formatted. MacOS dis-mounted the drive, and will not mount it again - bricked! I re-booted my machine and checked several WD and Apple tech support forums to no avail. My MacBook bricked this drive out of the box due to the drive formatted as Windows. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Granata

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play does no work!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second WD Elements portal ext. hard drive. The first one (500 GB) is almost full. The install instruction says Plug and Play. So I plugged in an USB portal. But nothing has happened. I went WD Support and downloaded drivers. But even the WD BackUp Appt does not recognize it and wants to direct me to DropBox. The Windows 10 cannot “find” the device. I have to use Add a device to find it. Finally the problem solved by using Back and Restore (Windows 7) function. I am not a computer guy and don’t know if the problem is universal with Windows 10. Just to share my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Going strong as a backup drive for 2 years now!
customer_reviews.text: Works with Mac. Super portable. Uses USB A to connect to the laptop. Gets only mildly warm during backups. No loud whirring. In total, it makes regular backing up of the laptop a frustration-free task. Buy this thing before your laptop crashes and you run pillar to post and spend $$$ to get data extracted directly from the drive. You can tell that someone made that mistake :p
customer_reviews.author: Shine

customer_reviews.title: Be aware! Amazon search said this was a solid state drive. It's a mechanical hard disk.
customer_reviews.text: I was careless in ordering. This drive came up in an Amazon search as a "solid state drive" and I read no further. Be aware. It is not. It is a mechanical hard disk. Like any hard disk, it will last longer if kept horizontal or vertical, but not anywhere in between. Also, it will not be as fast as a solid state drive in your laptop. That said, it's fast, sets up easily with the accompanying instructions, and was a third the price of an equivalent 2T solid state drive. I'm keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Enriquez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy hookup to the Xbox one. . Works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: kytim2

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hard drive to upload videos onto for work. I use a PC. I have friends who edit in Mac. This hard drive is a read only in Mac and complicated to get to work...and still isn't. Then, as I'm dealing with this issue the hard drive decides to just stop working. So ya, a bunch of work lost forever. I'm so pissed at this worthless hard drive...I'll never buy anything from WD again, EVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Pollitt

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: These are great little drives. I own several of them. Minus one star because the most recent revision of this product comes with a cheapo USB cable that has no identifying marks or detents to tell you which way is up! I haven't seen that since 1996 and is a really annoying way to show your customers you are cheap and don't care about them. Next time around I'll probably try Seagate or Toshiba.
customer_reviews.author: Zapp Brannigan

customer_reviews.title: Great Size but doesn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: I love these drives because they are super small and compact. Unfortunately, this is one of many of these that dont even last a year. This one is 10 months old and is shot. Disk utility can't repair it, so I had to buy another one. I do not schlepp these around or even travel with them. it sits in my drawer and is use only once in a while to run backup. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: east side photo

customer_reviews.title: Dead Again
customer_reviews.text: The original drive was DOA. It was replaced. This second drive seemed to work okay. I copied files to it. Now, when I hooked it back up ALL of the files were missing. So, maybe I had done something wrong the first time. I started backing up files again. The drive seemed to be working okay. About 1/3 of the way through my files it had a small problem. So, I decided to wait until this morning to finish. NoGo! This drive was completely DEAD! So much for WD drives. I am going to have to get a replacement from a different manufacturer. Do NOT Buy this junk.
customer_reviews.author: W. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Been replaced twice
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine drive when it works. But it failed after a few weeks and was sent back to WD for a replacement. The replacement itself had to be replaced a few weeks after I received it. I have bought two other drives from WD or its subsidiaries this year, and they have both had to be replaced. In each case, I had to pay for shipping the drive back to WD. In the future, I will spend a little more on my drives in hopes of finding a more reliable manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Not for daily use apparently!
customer_reviews.text: Storage side is right. I used the devices to store some games on for my kids. I ordered the hard drive on September 5th and started using it as soon as it came in. Its now October 11th (36 days later) and the hard drive has bricked up and no longer registers (Its corrupted and wont register to allow me to fix drive sectors). I would recommend this unit to anyone who only need to use it once a month for documents they don't mind losing, if you need something for daily use, find another product that can handle the work load.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 5 months of use, the unit under warranty (!!!), absence of customer support
customer_reviews.text: The unit I bought in January failed (after 5 months of use) with obvious electric circuit failure around USB connection, which started a while ago with bad USB connection and losing a contact and failed completely after few days, so it's impossible to start the hard drive. Obviously it's under 2 year manufacturer warranty, it checks out when I enter WD website. The funny thing is that I opened a case 4 days ago and it stays untouched by anyone from WD side. I have no idea how long should I wait for the reaction to get this faulty Hard Drive replaced? So fortunate I don't have any sensitive or lost information there
customer_reviews.author: ighost

customer_reviews.title: like so many other reviews, it just stops being readable
customer_reviews.text: i got two based on price . . . and got what I paid for. Worked great, read/write/copy/hold files for later and dismount to take with during electrical storms, come home plug in, read several chapters of my book and work on them, and about 6 months along I come home plug it in and my iMac doesn't see it. my tech tries on my iMac and his, nada. then he tries on his PC. nada. I still have it . . . I think. I bought Toshiba instead.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest830

customer_reviews.title: Drive Was Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Hard Drive would not work or start right out of the box. I tried several cables, two windows, on mac, and one linux machine, my playstation. Nothing just a light. I even popped open the case after several days of trouble shooting to find the connection between the male and female connections was competely fine, all pins intact. I have used WD for a decade and a half. I am rethinking my loyalty.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pittman

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in and it had failed giving error "the file or directory is corrupted and unreadable". Going through their trouble shooting with Western Digital Data LifeGuard Diagnostics - per their support site. I ran the shorter diagnostic, it failed with two different error messages. Running the Extended diagnostic right now. It says it'll take over 3 hours. If this doesn't work, I will be returning it. Thanks WD - I hate it already. Ran all diagnostics but it still didn't work - returning item.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this. Very Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of WD. However, I am very regret for buying this one. For the second time of using it, the drive started to have the repeated "clicking" noise, which means it is going to dead soon. I contacted custom service and got a replacement. However, for my new replaced drive, after using it for another 5 months, my Mac suddenly cannot recognize the drive and indicates that there was an error and asked me to reformat the drive. I have never seen any external drive so unreliable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a matter of days - lost all my data!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, horrible external hard drive! It stopped working within days of using it and I lost ALL MY DATA! I was devastated. I have used other external hard drives before and all worked fine. I have spent the past few weeks trying to recover my data, and working with different people to try and help but all to no avail. Now that I know the device is completely useless I will begin the process of returning it and see how WD responds. I will never buy or recommend another WD product again.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Absolute s**t. Do not buy if you care about your data.
customer_reviews.text: A few months in this hard drive starts making a very consistent grinding/clicking sound as soon as I plug it in, even before any reading or writing is done. The drive has not failed completely yet but this is usually an indication of eminent failure. Unfortunately it has passed the return date. It is still in warranty so I'm planning to request a replacement through warranty service --- however WD warranty does not offer replacement with new hard drives: you get a used one if your old one starts malfunctioning! How ridiculous! I would definitely NOT recommend this hard drive, or any WD products for that matter, due to the inferior quality and the stupid warranty policy of WD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cheaper than passport due to no software
customer_reviews.text: i'm using this elements device a replacement for an older passport. that passport is at least 8 yrs old and was beginning to have some errors. for those who want the included wd backup app, it's not there and if u get it directly from the wd website, it will not work with the elements drive. if u must have that app, go with the passport for a few $$ more. being a win10 user, the backup app embedded with the os works fine; and YES, it does allow specific files to be backed-up or restored. in theory, u can use this one drive to backup multiple 'puters. so i'm good with it!
customer_reviews.author: g - raleigh burbs

customer_reviews.title: Great for my XBOX.  Did have to format on computer first.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use with my XBOX One X. I had a slight issue with the console not recognizing the drive when connected. I then connected the drive to my computer and it was seen right away. I formatted the drive as NTFS on the computer and then connected it to the console again. It was then recognized right away. The console then formatted the drive again and I was off. I love the extra storage. No more having to delete games when I want to add new ones.
customer_reviews.author: C. Demeter

customer_reviews.title: My favorite external storage device!
customer_reviews.text: I own many portable storage devices, but the Elements is my favorite because of it's RELIABILITY, smoothness in and out of pocket and all around good feel in hand, scratch resistance shell, and it's not too finicky on which cable I use. I own a range of them: 750GB, 1TB, 2TB and now 2 new 3TB. I also own a few Seagate Backup Plus small portable storage devices, but they drive me crazy because they only work on certain cables and USB connectors, and one of them died on me shortly after I bought it. I've never gotten a bad Elements, or had a problem with any of them in the last 3 years. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mutock

customer_reviews.title: It's impossible to believe how slow this drive is......
customer_reviews.text: I have had many, many WD portable drives and all have been good - not necessarily long lived but good. This drive is unimaginably slooooooooow. I got it for an additional TimeMachine backup drive and after two weeks - not continuously plugged in, but a substantial amount of it was - it still isn't encrypted. Trying to get data onto it is a joke. It may have a USB3 interface, but I think decrepit ants move the data internally. An abysmal purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Graham B. Bird

customer_reviews.title: They don't last
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these replaced in the last year. They seem to work all right for a period of time, then then just crash, which then puts my computer into a lock type state. When this happens if I unplug it from the computer hook up then the computer is all right, thank god. My suggestion is find some other brand or another external drive. At least they didn't require me to send the old one back because I had all kinds of information on it that I didn't want to be extracted by someone.
customer_reviews.author: hokenrr

customer_reviews.title: Faulty drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two 4TB drives one formatted fine and had minimal vibration but the other vibrated wildly and would not format properly on my iMac. I am computer savvy and know how to format the "top" drive in Disk Utility but this drive was not operating normally. I attempted to format the 4TB drive into five-800GB partitions and each time it would come back part of the drive needs to be resized and each time I wound up with other than 800GB partitions. I attempted to repair the drive , re-format all to no avail.......so I returned it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Just like every WD product I have ever purchased.. Dead after a year.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a chance last year because it was on sale. I am not surprised at all that it is totally dead after a year. I used it a couple times and it was full of photos and videos of fam and friends. Never again.. I should have learned my lessons with the two MyBooks I had in the past.. To make things worse the connector is hardwired and proprietary so there is no way to retreive your own data from it after it dies like every WD product I have ever owned. Avoid this company's hard drives like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on mac
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this prouct if you have one of the latest Macs with updated software. The icon does not appear on the desktop and can not be found anywhere. I tried multiple times. Never had this experience with an external hard drive - and I have several. Never bought Western Digital product before and I will never by it again! It is going back!!! Custimer service is also weird. Tried to call and got no where - not a good option. Tried to send an email using their online form and the form doesn't really offer what I was asking so i couldn't send it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great for porn.
customer_reviews.text: Some guys have a dirty mag under their mattress. I have 2tb of the internet’s finest. When mom asks, I just tell her it’s my backups of my school papers. Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T.

customer_reviews.title: Computer Stopped Recognising It After 1 Week
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first week, and now my computer no longer recognises this drive as being connected to my 2019 MacBook Pro running OSX Catalina. I've uninstalled it, changed USB ports it was connected to, etc., all to no avail. No matter what I do, my computer doesn't "see" this drive any more. No idea what happened today, but to lose all my backups is DEVASTATING! Save your money and go with a different option. I tried reaching out to someone about this issue, only to find there was no clear way to do so. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: kbxavierTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great storage solution
customer_reviews.text: Not real sure of the durability yet because I recieved it for Christmas. I decided to put it on my kids xbox one x for game storage for now. The x box formatted it easily and I was able to start grabbing games off of game pass. The USB 3.0 is nice but it would be nicer with a 7200 rpm platter. It is a very nice 4 tb hard drive and I can't complain because of how inexpensive the storage is. I thought the HDD would have been bigger but I was pleasantly surprised at how compact it is. All in all its great, at least, until solid state hard drives come down in price.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M Pickett

customer_reviews.title: WD Elements external hard drive-non functional
customer_reviews.text: Neither my MacBook Pro or my wife's MacBook Air would recognize this new Elements hard drive. I purchased my first Elements in 2015 and it works perfectly. I was unable to connect this new Elements until yesterday when I wanted to back-up my wife's computer. I would like to discuss a return and/or credit before I order another Elements drive. fcschneider@hotmail.com; 301-775-2096
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Device was never dropped (and never left the house), near anything magnetic and the like but all of a sudden it is corrupted and I cannot access the data on which countless hours were spent transferring and organizing. It's not even heavy enough to make a decent paperweight! I thought since it was just going from one computer in my house to another that an SSD would not be necessary but apparently this portable external drive is not that portable.
customer_reviews.author: nebraska mom

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if my drive was defective or improperly packaged
customer_reviews.text: I got this drive to make a system backup and store some other things. After making my system backup, I right clicked on the drive to see how much space was taken up by the backup. It was half. I thought, that can't be, this is a 2 TB drive. That is when I noticed the total capacity was 32 GB! I used Amazon chat and the representative started the return process for me, which I was going to do anyhow. I decided to get a Seagate T5 SSD drive instead.
customer_reviews.author: fxtrtr

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: I got this as external storage for my Tablo Dual Lite DVR. It worked perfectly for 6 months, and then died. No reason. No problems at all. Just one day it was done and would never work again. I’ll never buy another Western Digital product, after reading many many reports of this same kind of thing happening to many people who bought their devices. I’ve now replaced this hard drive with a Seagate. Its reviews (outside of Amazon as well) are great so I’m optimistic. It’s working great right out of the box. Hopefully it lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 8 months. Didn't use it too much, just as a backup. When I started to use it to move large amounts of files between work and home, it pretty much died. First there were constant errors, and Windows won't recognize it. Disk management shows it, but it won't initialize because of "fatal device hardware error." Expected better than this. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price for lots of storage
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to make a system image of my laptop to because my Windows 10 update failed before and I was lucky that it recovered itself and it was able to roll itself back to before the update was applied. Online communication with Microsoft Community suggested I make a system image and a recovery drive, in case this ever happened again. It was suggested I buy something like this, as it would have more space than I would ever need, and it's not very expensive. I have several external WD hard drives so I went with this product because I've never had any problems with WD drives.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: TWO DRIVES, TWO FAILURES
customer_reviews.text: Bought first WD drive roughly a month ago and it failed with a week. Returned and bought another. Second drive also failed quickly and produced the dreaded "click of death" other disgruntled buyers have mentioned. One failure I can dismiss as a fluke. Two? Uh, NO. Crappy product and inexcusable waste of hours of my time. If you need a drive be smart and LOOK ELSEWHERE. This model is fragile and unreliable despite the misleading ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Snook

customer_reviews.title: NO WD SW for Windows
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I should have done some more research but there is zero WD software for windows that supports this product. If you were buying this to use as a plug and play password protected backup you cannot. Basically an oversized USB stick so you can use Windows Backup FileHistory with it. Not that big of a deal and maybe exactly what some people are looking for however they should just spell it out that is what you have to do. Do not waste your time trying to make this compatible with other software.
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. An absolute nightmare.
customer_reviews.text: I thought that this hard drive had been doing my Time Machine back ups for my iMac and it turned out it was creating new backup folders but not actually storing anything in them. I lost a lot of data. This was the one time I was cheap with a hard drive purchase and I will never not buy a G-Tech - A company I have trusted for over a decade - ever again. I got what I paid for with this and had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: Works so well, I bought several more
customer_reviews.text: I've found these drives very reliable so I bought several at different capacities (1TB through 4TB). I've been very satisfied with all of them. They work well on both PC & Mac. I've knocked them around by accident, although not tortured them, and they still work like a champ. The performance is great when connected to USB 3.0, but I have older computers with USB 2.0 and they work just fine (although about 50% slower). I'm very happy to give this drive 5 stars!! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital WONT replace your hard drive ' AVOID THIS PROBLEM
customer_reviews.text: They wont help you replace the hdd no matter the problem, Dont believe in the warranty. Emails and emails and more email and more useless calls with representatives reading you tips from internet to "help you fix the drive" WOW! I cant believe the disrespect! I am going to another brand for sure! BYEEEEE!!! Thanks for nothing! GO SAMSUNG!!!!!! or whatever
customer_reviews.author: Reynaldo

customer_reviews.title: WD 2TB is for M-E!
customer_reviews.text: My last external hard drive took a dive after owning it for about 2 years. I treated it with the same care as this one. I feel this hard drive is more durable and can withstand being in a backpack, transported in cold/hot weather. Now don't leave it out in the sun or stored in your car all winter. I bring mine in daily after recording music at a studio and store it in a drawer in the house. Bottom line is, this is worth the purchase and can hold your recording/music sessions well.
customer_reviews.author: MinneapolisMark

customer_reviews.title: Used for backup/transfer once and device is now making noises and isn't working reliably
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 2TB Western Digital USB-powered in 2018 to backup files when I was moving between laptops. The device has operated for no more than 24 hours total since I got it and has spent most of its time in a file cabinet file folder. I have another drive like this that I purchased several months later that seems to be operating normally. Out of the two Costco Seagate (purchased in 2017,2018) and two Amazon Western Digital (purchased in 2018,2019) 2TB self-powered HDDs I have purchased thus far, the 2018 Western Digital on the only one to fail.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work - broke after one month of light use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on June 2 and it is July 6 and it doesn't work - kaput, gone done for. For the price I certainly expected more. i i got it set up and for about 2 weeks it was working. Then, it started to beep. Beep? No other external hard drive ever beeped but since it didn't come with instructions I had no clue. then it just stopped working. If ELEMENTS gets this I'd like a full refund. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lunar Day

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This was just piece of junk ... I bought this for my father as a gift while visiting him for the holidays ... it didn’t work .. I tried every possible way mentioned in comments and online suggestions but nothing worked... sadly I bought it almost month and half in advance and never checked to see if it’s working as I trusted the brand value and name. It was both huge disappointment and embarrassment. If I could I would have returned it instead of throwing it in bin.
customer_reviews.author: VD

customer_reviews.title: If you can get this drive at a reasonable cost, by all means, do it!
customer_reviews.text: If you can manage to catch a deal on a low price for this drive...grab it! You cannot go wrong with a portable, external 4TB hard drive that is USB 3.0 compatible. For a drive this size you’ll need a fast transfer rate and this drive provides plenty of space and speed. The brand is good as well. I have four drives and they have lasted years without issue. Not all are 4TB, but they are two 2TB drives and two 4TB drives and they have been flawless. I transferred most files from my Alienware 17 laptop that was almost full and sluggish and now, it flies again in speed.
customer_reviews.author: Mihalis in Kansas

customer_reviews.title: Long-time WD Customer Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have used Western Digital products for a very long time. All my files are saved twice, to WD external hard drives. My old 1TB WD Passport is still going strong after many, many years. I recently purchased this Elements external hard derive in Oct. 2019, and it's already malfunctioning to replace and even older Passport, which was still functioning but starting to make noise. This Elements in malfunctioning while the Passport is still going strong. I'm really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jduran0804

customer_reviews.title: Crashed after 6 months of using.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many external hard drives in the last 10 years, and note I leave my externals on my desk, never carrying them around, in and out of bags. Externals are junk. They don't last forever. I started to hear some weird sounds coming out of it a week ago, so I made sure my cloud's back up was current before having an anxiety attack. 1 week later, my WD Elements I bought 4/15/19 stopped. It no longer was readable and is dead. No reason for this. SO don't rely on externals, no matter the brand! This is my 2nd one to crash, but thought the first one was because I moved it around and never reported it.
customer_reviews.author: kmac

customer_reviews.title: 2 years and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this hard drive for over 2 years now I just noticed and it's worked flawlessly without any problems. I bought the 2 TB to use with my Mac and I still have about 1 TB left. I backup my Mac using Time Machine.. My old Mac died and I was easily able to transfer everything to the new computer using the hard drive. It runs pretty quiet and I feel it's very reliable. I leave it plugged in most of the time. Doesn't seem to spin unless computer is on but the little white light does blink if plugged in. WD is a very well known and respected company. Very glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: C. Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great price for 1TB. I connected this to my PS4 to help expand the memory since every game I download is maxing out my storage and requires me to delete previous game history. Highly recommended for less expensive, yet reliable storage. The only downside is an LED light on the device that blinks rapidly when the drive is connected. It can be distracting/ annoying if it's in your line of sight, but a very minimal issue that can be easily fixed with masking tape, post-it note, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: NON TECH SAVVY SENIOR ALERT
customer_reviews.text: Not being tech savvy I had no idea what formatting meant but soon found that this external hard drive had to be formatted before it would work with my 2015 MacBook Pro (running Catalina 10.15.4) . Thankfully, it's a simple process. (DISK UTILITY > External ["ELEMENTS"] > Erase drop-down menu > Format (chose Max OS Extended...) > Erase) I am using this like a thumb drive, drag and drop, and very pleased with the ease of use and its capacity. Having read reviews that indicate that the WD Elements doesn't have a long life span I'll update this review if my ELEMENTS does suffer an untimely demise.
customer_reviews.author: IBoughtThat

customer_reviews.title: So far, This is The WORST product I've ever bought on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I spent two nights trying to configure this disk for my mac book. I followed the instructions and also the online knowledge base per the manual. But after trying so many times, this hard drive just doesn't work. It's EXTEREMELY slow and BARELY responds to any commands. Eg. The options from "Right clicking" on on the harddrive takes 1 minute to show up. I also made sure my macbook had no issues on its own so it's definitely not my macbook. I'm just super disappointed with this product. It's a faulty product! I just can't wait to return this product and get rid of it ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: BX

customer_reviews.title: PS4 PRO STORAGE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my PS4 PRO And it seams to be working great may be even a little faster than the hard drive that comes in the PS4 PRO console. Transferring the games over is really quick also. Gives me a total of 3TB in storage. All you have to do is go to settings and devices and format for PS4 and seems to work as if it was made for it. So far so good but if any issues come up I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Sams

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Portable, and Lots of Storage
customer_reviews.text: I have only used Western Digital since other brands failed me. I also use several Western Digital EHDs as backups. These are super portable and easy to use. Don't waste your money with the "expert set-up" option (set-up includes plugging it in... that's it). All EHDs will fail eventually - I've found little "tells" with the WD brand that are helpful in determining when a new one needs to be purchased (usually every 2 years). When your computer has moments where it can't locate the EHD, then it's starting to fail. At least with some warning, you can get a new one! :)
customer_reviews.author: M. Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Corrupt after less than two months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hard drive in September 2019 - so not only two months ago. I moved all of my files to it. When I went back in to access my files a few weeks later, it is now corrupt and I've lost all of my data. A data recovery service is quoting me $3900 to get my files back. Do not risk putting anything of value on this external hard drive. If you can't lose it, don't use this! Lesson learned the very hard way.
customer_reviews.author: BelindaG

customer_reviews.title: Use for time machine back up is troubling.
customer_reviews.text: The process of using this device as a time machine backup storage medium for macOS Catalina isn't very intuitive and runs into errors after the first back up is written after a format of the drive. This prevents the drive from being able to be used as an active backup of my MacBook in that I need to format the drive every time I want time machine to be able to write a new back up to it. There's probably a solution to this problem already but I haven't had the time to find it. I would rate the product higher if these issues were not present at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as 2tb, Only 1.8tb
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Windows 10 reads is at 1.81tb. That's 199gb less than advertised which is a good amount of movies! Feels like and clearly a thin-ish plastic shell, the top side is thin enough to flex if you push down with your thumb a bit. Could crack with a bit more force. Pros: Fast shipping Plug and play Good price
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Crashed after using twice
customer_reviews.text: I have had tons of WD external hard drives and have loved them all, until this one. I didn't use it right away after purchasing as I was trying to organize my digital supplies before I backed them up on this drive. First time I added folders to the drive there were no issues. The second time I added folders to the drive, it crashed. I now get an error when I plug it in. Very disappointed I have a useless 4 TB hard drive sitting here after purchasing less than 6 months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A Walker

customer_reviews.title: BE WARNED: FAILS IN LESS THAN 1-YEAR
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even last 9-months. Just a stupid expensive paper weight now! I would ask you to replace it, but I would never trust another one of your hard drives again. If you had any moral code, you'd refund the people that you screw over with your horrible products. The $99 is the least of my worries now - all my business data is GONE.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda  Levy

customer_reviews.title: Can't Trust It
customer_reviews.text: I spent over two hours copying my entire C drive so that I could reformat it to get rid of about ten years of junk files. But when I checked the USER folder on the WD Elements copy, there were no photos copied! So, had I assumed the files were saved, they would have been lost--and how can I use this to back up files if I need to verify thousands of files to make sure they were actually copied? I returned it and ordered a similar Seagate drive.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with tons of storage
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful hard drive. I use mine to back up all of my photos on. I had a 1TB from this brand (for about 5 yrs now) and I have never had issues with it, but it is full and for just a few extra bucks, I have 3 times the storage now. I do not see myself running out of room anytime soon. My son uses his to keep all of his PS4 gaming stuff on. He had no space and this allows him plenty of room to store his gaming stuff on.
customer_reviews.author: Me
